subject: Re: [junit] Junit-add-ons to test private methods.
msgSnippet: The example code .. public void testISDirectoryTrue() throws Throwable { String[] lData = { . , .. , ... , /. , /.. , /... , abc/. , }; for ( int i = 0;
messageBody:
The example code ..

public void testISDirectoryTrue() throws Throwable
{
String[] lData =
{
".",
"..",
"...",
"/.",
"/..",
"/...",
"abc/.",
};

for ( int i = 0; i < lData.length; i++ )
{
Boolean b = (Boolean) PrivateAccessor.invoke( URIHelper.class,
"needsToAppendDirectorySeperator",
new Class[]{String.class},
new Object[]{lData[i]} );
assertTrue( b.booleanValue() );
}
}//testISDirectory()

This test is trying to test static private method
"needsToAppendDirectorySeperator" of class URIHelper.


Regards,
Nagendra

meera.ramachandran@... wrote:

> Please let me know how to test Private methods in Junit using Junit
